trans-unit.source: Using the SharePoint Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the SharePoint Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the SharePoint Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the SharePoint Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the SharePoint Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the SharePoint Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect SharePoint Server or SharePoint Online to manage documents and list items.
trans-unit.target: Connect SharePoint Server or SharePoint Online to manage documents and list items.

trans-unit.source: You can perform various actions such as create, update, get, and delete on documents and list items.
trans-unit.target: You can perform various actions such as create, update, get, and delete on documents and list items.

trans-unit.source: When using on-premises SharePoint server, you enter the Service Bus Connection String as part of connector configuration and install the on-premises listener agent to connect to the server.
trans-unit.target: When using on-premises SharePoint server, you enter the Service Bus Connection String as part of connector configuration and install the on-premises listener agent to connect to the server.

trans-unit.source: The SharePoint Online Connector and SharePoint Server Connector gallery app provides you Trigger and Actions as mechanisms to interact with SharePoint.
trans-unit.target: The SharePoint Online Connector and SharePoint Server Connector gallery app provides you Trigger and Actions as mechanisms to interact with SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the SharePoint Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the SharePoint Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: Select **API Apps** and search for “SharePoint Online Connector”.
trans-unit.target: Select **API Apps** and search for “SharePoint Online Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Site URL | Yes | Enter the complete URL of the SharePoint web site.
trans-unit.target: Site URL | Yes | Enter the complete URL of the SharePoint web site.

trans-unit.source: Document Library / List Relative URLs | Yes | Enter the document libraries/lists URLs, relative to the SharePoint site URL, that are allowed to be modified by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Document Library / List Relative URLs | Yes | Enter the document libraries/lists URLs, relative to the SharePoint site URL, that are allowed to be modified by the connector.

trans-unit.source: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Once that’s done, you can now create a logic App in the same resource group to use the SharePoint Online Connector.
trans-unit.target: Once that’s done, you can now create a logic App in the same resource group to use the SharePoint Online Connector.

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: Select **API Apps** and search for “SharePoint Server Connector”.
trans-unit.target: Select **API Apps** and search for “SharePoint Server Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Site URL | Yes | Enter the complete URL of the SharePoint web site.
trans-unit.target: Site URL | Yes | Enter the complete URL of the SharePoint web site.

trans-unit.source: Authentication Mode | Yes | Enter the authentication mode to connect to SharePoint Site.
trans-unit.target: Authentication Mode | Yes | Enter the authentication mode to connect to SharePoint Site.

trans-unit.source: If you choose Default, the credentials running the SharePoint Connector are used; Username/Password are not required.
trans-unit.target: If you choose Default, the credentials running the SharePoint Connector are used; Username/Password are not required.

trans-unit.source: Username and Password are required for other authentication types.
trans-unit.target: Username and Password are required for other authentication types.

trans-unit.source: User Name | No | Enter a valid user name to connect to SharePoint site, if Authentication mode is not Default.
trans-unit.target: User Name | No | Enter a valid user name to connect to SharePoint site, if Authentication mode is not Default.

trans-unit.source: Password | No | Enter a valid password to connect to SharePoint site, if Authentication mode is not Default.
trans-unit.target: Password | No | Enter a valid password to connect to SharePoint site, if Authentication mode is not Default.

trans-unit.source: Document Library / List Relative URLs | Yes | Enter the document libraries/lists URLs, relative to the SharePoint site URL, that are allowed to be modified by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Document Library / List Relative URLs | Yes | Enter the document libraries/lists URLs, relative to the SharePoint site URL, that are allowed to be modified by the connector.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Connection String | No | If you're connecting to on-premises, enter the Service Bus relay connection string.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Connection String | No | If you're connecting to on-premises, enter the Service Bus relay connection string.

trans-unit.source: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Once that’s done, you can now create a logic App in the same resource group to use the SharePoint Server Connector.
trans-unit.target: Once that’s done, you can now create a logic App in the same resource group to use the SharePoint Server Connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the SharePoint Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the SharePoint Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the SharePoint Connector as a trigger or action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the SharePoint Connector as a trigger or action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group that has the SharePoint Connector.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group that has the SharePoint Connector.

trans-unit.source: Open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your workflow.
trans-unit.target: Open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your workflow.

trans-unit.source: The SharePoint Connector appears in the “Recently Used” section in the gallery on the right hand side.
trans-unit.target: The SharePoint Connector appears in the “Recently Used” section in the gallery on the right hand side.

trans-unit.source: If SharePoint connector is selected at the start of the logic app, it acts like trigger.
trans-unit.target: If SharePoint connector is selected at the start of the logic app, it acts like trigger.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, actions could be taken on SharePoint account using the connector.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, actions could be taken on SharePoint account using the connector.

trans-unit.source: When using the SharePoint Online Connector, you have to authenticate and authorize logic apps to perform operations on your behalf.
trans-unit.target: When using the SharePoint Online Connector, you have to authenticate and authorize logic apps to perform operations on your behalf.

trans-unit.source: To start the authorization, click **Authorize** on SharePoint Connector:
trans-unit.target: To start the authorization, click **Authorize** on SharePoint Connector:

trans-unit.source: Clicking Authorize would open SharePoint’s authentication dialog.
trans-unit.target: Clicking Authorize would open SharePoint’s authentication dialog.

trans-unit.source: Enter the sign in details of the SharePoint account on which you want to perform the operations:
trans-unit.target: Enter the sign in details of the SharePoint account on which you want to perform the operations:

trans-unit.source: Grant logic apps access to your account to perform operation on your behalf:
trans-unit.target: Grant logic apps access to your account to perform operation on your behalf:

trans-unit.source: If the SharePoint Connector is configured as Trigger, then the triggers are shown.
trans-unit.target: If the SharePoint Connector is configured as Trigger, then the triggers are shown.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, a list of actions is displayed and you can choose appropriate operation that you want to perform:
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, a list of actions is displayed and you can choose appropriate operation that you want to perform:

trans-unit.source: Relative URL configured for document list
trans-unit.target: Relative URL configured for document list

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]For the following triggers, it is assumed that you entered 'Shared Documents, Lists/Task' in the Connector Package settings, where 'Shared Documents' is a document library and 'Lists/Task' is a List.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]For the following triggers, it is assumed that you entered 'Shared Documents, Lists/Task' in the Connector Package settings, where 'Shared Documents' is a document library and 'Lists/Task' is a List.

trans-unit.source: Use triggers if you want to initiate a logic app.
trans-unit.target: Use triggers if you want to initiate a logic app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Triggers delete the files after reading them.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Triggers delete the files after reading them.

trans-unit.source: To preserve these files, please enter a value for the archive location.
trans-unit.target: To preserve these files, please enter a value for the archive location.

trans-unit.source: This trigger is fired when a new document is available in 'Shared Documents'.
trans-unit.target: This trigger is fired when a new document is available in 'Shared Documents'.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid view used to filter documents to be picked.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid view used to filter documents to be picked.

trans-unit.source: To process all the existing documents, leave this field empty.
trans-unit.target: To process all the existing documents, leave this field empty.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid folder URL, relative to SharePoint site, where the processed documents are archived.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid folder URL, relative to SharePoint site, where the processed documents are archived.

trans-unit.source: Check this option to overwrite a file in Archive path if it already exists.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to overwrite a file in Archive path if it already exists.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid Caml query to filter documents.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid Caml query to filter documents.

trans-unit.source: Content Transfer Encoding of the Message.
trans-unit.target: Content Transfer Encoding of the Message.

trans-unit.source: **Note** All the columns of the document item are shown in 'Advanced' output properties.
trans-unit.target: **Note** All the columns of the document item are shown in 'Advanced' output properties.

trans-unit.source: This trigger is fired when a new item is added in 'Tasks' list.
trans-unit.target: This trigger is fired when a new item is added in 'Tasks' list.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid view used to filter items in the list.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid view used to filter items in the list.

trans-unit.source: To process all the all the new items, leave this field empty.
trans-unit.target: To process all the all the new items, leave this field empty.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid folder URL, relative to SharePoint site, where the processed list items are archived.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid folder URL, relative to SharePoint site, where the processed list items are archived.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid Caml query to filter documents.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid Caml query to filter documents.

trans-unit.source: The columns in the list are dynamically populated and shown in the output parameters.
trans-unit.target: The columns in the list are dynamically populated and shown in the output parameters.

trans-unit.source: This trigger is fired when a new document is available in 'Shared Documents'.
trans-unit.target: This trigger is fired when a new document is available in 'Shared Documents'.

trans-unit.source: The new document is returned as an XML message.
trans-unit.target: The new document is returned as an XML message.

trans-unit.target: Enter a valid folder URL, relative to SharePoint site, where the processed list documents are archived.

trans-unit.source: Check this option to overwrite a file in Archive path if it already exists.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to overwrite a file in Archive path if it already exists.

trans-unit.target: Enter a valid Caml query to filter documents.

trans-unit.target: This trigger is fired when a new item is added in 'Tasks' list.

trans-unit.target: The new list item is returned as an XML message.

trans-unit.target: Enter a valid view used to filter items in the list.

trans-unit.target: To process all the new items, leave this field empty.

trans-unit.source: For the following actions, it is assumed that you entered 'Shared Documents, Lists/Task' in Connector Package settings, where 'Shared Documents' is a document library and 'Lists/Task' is a List.
trans-unit.target: For the following actions, it is assumed that you entered 'Shared Documents, Lists/Task' in Connector Package settings, where 'Shared Documents' is a document library and 'Lists/Task' is a List.

trans-unit.source: This action uploads new document to 'Shared Documents'.
trans-unit.target: This action uploads new document to 'Shared Documents'.

trans-unit.source: The input is a strongly typed JSON object with all the column fields of the document library.
trans-unit.target: The input is a strongly typed JSON object with all the column fields of the document library.

trans-unit.source: Content Transfer Encoding of the Message.
trans-unit.target: Content Transfer Encoding of the Message.

trans-unit.source: If set to TRUE and a document exists with the given name, it will be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: If set to TRUE and a document exists with the given name, it will be overwritten.

trans-unit.target: This is one of the required parameters to add a document in the document library.

trans-unit.target: This is one of the required parameters to add a document in the document library.

trans-unit.target: This is one of the optional parameters to add a document in the document library.

trans-unit.target: **Note** All the parameters of the document library are dynamically populated.

trans-unit.target: The mandatory parameters are visible, where the optional parameters are in advanced section.

trans-unit.target: ItemId of the document added in Document library.

trans-unit.target: A successful upload of document returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.target: This action gets the document from the document library given the relative URL (folder structure) of the document.

trans-unit.source: Enter the document URL, relative to 'Shared Documents'.
trans-unit.target: Enter the document URL, relative to 'Shared Documents'.

trans-unit.source: This action lists all the documents in a document library.

trans-unit.source: This action uploads new document to 'Shared Documents'.

trans-unit.target: The input document should be an XML payload.

trans-unit.target: A successful upload of document returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: This action adds an item in the Item list.
trans-unit.target: This action adds an item in the Item list.

trans-unit.source: The input is expected to be an XML payload.
trans-unit.target: The input is expected to be an XML payload.

trans-unit.source: The XML message which contains the values of the fields of the list item to be inserted.
trans-unit.target: The XML message which contains the values of the fields of the list item to be inserted.

trans-unit.source: You can use Transform API App to generate the XML message.
trans-unit.target: You can use Transform API App to generate the XML message.

trans-unit.target: **Note** All the parameters of the 'List' are dynamically populated.

trans-unit.target: The mandatory parameters are visible, whereas the optional parameters are in advanced section.

trans-unit.target: ItemId of the List item added.

trans-unit.target: A successful insertion of List item returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.target: This action updates an item in the Item list.

trans-unit.source: The input is expected to be an XML payload.
trans-unit.target: The input is expected to be an XML payload.

trans-unit.target: The XML message which contains the values of the fields of the list item to be inserted.

trans-unit.target: A successful update of List item returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: This action gets an item from the Item list.
trans-unit.target: This action gets an item from the Item list.

trans-unit.source: The XML message which contains the values of the fields of the list item selected.
trans-unit.target: The XML message which contains the values of the fields of the list item selected.

trans-unit.source: A successful execute of action returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful execute of action returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This step is required only if you are using SharePoint on-premises behind your firewall.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This step is required only if you are using SharePoint on-premises behind your firewall.

trans-unit.source: App Service uses the Hybrid Configuration Manager to connect securely to your on-premises system.
trans-unit.target: App Service uses the Hybrid Configuration Manager to connect securely to your on-premises system.

trans-unit.source: If you're connector uses an on-premises SharePoint Server, the Hybrid Connection Manager is required.
trans-unit.target: If you're connector uses an on-premises SharePoint Server, the Hybrid Connection Manager is required.

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor API apps and connector](app-service-api-manage-in-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor API apps and connector](app-service-api-manage-in-portal.md).
